content: As a note of pedantry, this is actually an optional static type system, as not all static type systems have no runtime component. One very common example of a static type systems that do have a non-performance runtime component is C#, whose support for dynamic via the DLR and reified generics allow the runtime’s semantics to depend on the type system. Moreover, many more statically typed languages have type systems that can provide performance benefits, even if they have no runtime component.
